list_definition.definition: to answer with words, a reaction, gesture etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He didn’t respond to my question
I smiled at her, but she didn’t respond.

list_definition.definition: to show a good reaction eg to some course of treatment

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His illness did not respond to treatment by drugs.

list_definition.definition: (of vehicles etc) to be guided easily by controls

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The pilot said the plane did not respond to the controls.

list_ex_of_english: The task requires the use of word recognition skills to recognize a word or lexical item in order to respond.
This is an important issue because the underlying reasons for cost differences are crucial to knowing how best to respond to them.
Caregivers were also asked to identify which health professional strategies helped them prepare for and respond to their relative's death.
Some stimuli, if responded to, engender reward while others, if responded to, engender punishment.
The unit responded strongly when the edge was at a 0-pixel disparity in the middle of its receptive field.
Therefore, it is possible that homonyms would be responded to more accurately than novel words in a task emphasizing lexical representations, such as picture naming.
It presents the results of scholarly work in an accessible form, while at the same time responding to current events.
Other stimuli that will contribute to the pattern of responding include passage of time and environment (context).
